trans-unit.source: You can use a load balancer to provide high availability for your workloads in Azure.
trans-unit.target: You can use a load balancer to provide high availability for your workloads in Azure.

trans-unit.source: An Azure load balancer is a Layer-4 (TCP, UDP) type load balancer that distributes incoming traffic among healthy service instances in cloud services or virtual machines defined in a load balancer set.
trans-unit.target: An Azure load balancer is a Layer-4 (TCP, UDP) type load balancer that distributes incoming traffic among healthy service instances in cloud services or virtual machines defined in a load balancer set.

trans-unit.source: You can configure a load balancer to.
trans-unit.target: You can configure a load balancer to.

trans-unit.source: Load balance incoming Internet traffic to virtual machines (VMs).
trans-unit.target: Load balance incoming Internet traffic to virtual machines (VMs).

trans-unit.source: We refer to a load balancer in this scenario as an [Internet facing load balancer](load-balancer-internet-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: We refer to a load balancer in this scenario as an [Internet facing load balancer](load-balancer-internet-overview.md).

trans-unit.source: Load balance traffic between VMs in a virtual network (VNet), VMs in cloud services, or between on-premises computers and VMs in a cross-premises virtual network.
trans-unit.target: Load balance traffic between VMs in a virtual network (VNet), VMs in cloud services, or between on-premises computers and VMs in a cross-premises virtual network.

trans-unit.source: We refer to a load balancer in this scenario as an [internal load balancer (ILB)](load-balancer-internal-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: We refer to a load balancer in this scenario as an [internal load balancer (ILB)](load-balancer-internal-overview.md).

trans-unit.source: Forward external traffic to a specific VM instance.
trans-unit.target: Forward external traffic to a specific VM instance.
